short_summary: Replacing and repairing the approach and wharfhead at the Stewart Small Craft Harbour
description: The work to be carried out under this contract generally includes the following mandatory work details: mobilization/demobilization, removal of existing approach, detachment and reinstall of gangway, supply and installation of prefabricated steel approach, clearing and grubbing, excavation for new concrete post footings, installation of new concrete footings, installation of new steel posts, backfilling of slope, supply and placement of geotextile, supply and placement of new 10kg riprap, supply and placement of new 100kg riprap, and detachment and reinstall of utilities.
duration_in_months: There are no specific durations provided, but the contract period ends on March 31, 2024.
tags: Public Works Authority Infrastructure for Infrastructure management
full_summary:
### F1571-230371 - Stewart Small Craft Harbour Approach Replacement - Stewart, BC

#### Tender Details

* **Tender Reference:** WS4232298848
* **Publication Date:** October 4, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** October 19, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST

#### Project Overview

Fisheries and Oceans Canada is seeking a contractor to replace and repair the approach and wharfhead at the Stewart Small Craft Harbour.

#### Scope of Work

The project includes the following mandatory work:

1. Mobilization and demobilization
2. Removal of existing approach
3. Detach and reinstall gangway
4. Supply and installation of prefabricated steel approach
5. Clearing and grubbing
6. Excavation for new concrete post footings
7. Installation of new concrete footings
8. Installation of new steel posts
9. Backfilling of slope
10. Supply and placement of geotextile
11. Supply and placement of new 10kg riprap
12. Supply and placement of new 100kg riprap
13. Detach and reinstall utilities

#### Tender Requirements

* The tender is open to qualified contractors who can provide marine construction services, earthmoving services, demolition services, electrical system services, and concrete installation and repair services.
* The procuring agency is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC).
* The project will be selected based on the lowest price submitted.

#### Contact Information

* Agency: Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO)
* Contact Person: Klyne, Brandie (SPAC/PSPC)
* Contact Email: [brandie.klyne@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:brandie.klyne@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

#### Attachment

Access the tender notice and documentation at: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17628045?extsite=MTc2MjgwNDVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==
